author: John Scheerhout
title: Cheeky shoe firm sends Donald Trump pair of brogues and CONDOM in post - and got brilliant reply
text:
Trump in the Oval Office (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily   
A shoe company sent a £100 pair of size 12 brogues to Donald Trump , along with a condom - and claims to have received this unusual reply. 
Lancashire-based Goodwin Smith has previously sent shoes to many world leaders as part of an ambitious marketing gimmick. 
Now they claim to have received a personalised reply from the reality TV star-turned-leader of the free world. 
Along with the shoes, Goodwin Smith also included a condom and a letter praising President Trump as "a lad with swagger". 
The firm claims the shoes were returned on the grounds the president is not allowed to accept unsolicited gifts - but the condom was missing. 
The company posted a copy of its 'letter from Trump' on social media. The reply the company claims to have received from President Trump (Photo: Manchester Evening News) A pair of the barley black brogues sent to Washington (Photo: Goodwin Smith) Read More Giant Donald Trump snowman is YUGE attraction at Japanese snow festival 
Their initial letter to the White House said: “Congratulations on your victory. The Goodwin Smith team applauds you sir. You are truly one of the lads with swagger.” 
The alleged reply, carrying President Trump's signature, said: “Your letter and gift reached me in the Oval Office. Thank you for thinking of me and your kind gesture. It means a lot. Thank you also for your kind words on my presidency.” 
The president apparently praised the company for calling him "one of the lads with swagger" and quoted from his own 1987 book ,The Art of the Deal, which decries those who ‘think small’. The firm's letter to the White House (Photo: Manchester Evening News) Read More People are worried about Melania Trump again after seeing President's Super Bowl party photos 
“By daring to send your product, you have shown a winning mindset. The included condom gives a unique touch to your brand,” he supposedly wrote. 
He continues: “You were correct. I am a size 12 and I’m confident the Barley Black would have suited me as my first term begins. 
"As you are aware, I am half British and I would have been so proud to wear a British product. 
"Unfortunately, due to White House policy, I am unable to accept unsolicited goods. Please see enclosed the shoes and accept my deepest apology.” 
Appearing to encourage more gifts when he is no longer president, he adds: “For future reference, I tend to distance myself from black as a rule.” 
The company’s PR manager Simon Smith insists that the letter is genuine and said they had also sent shoes to Russian President Vladimir Putin. 
He said: “We were very surprised. We couldn’t believe it. It’s obviously not a standard response. He’s obviously read the letter and replied.” Like us on Facebook
